gurmukhi: jwmvwn bD isMG ko min lY mn suKu pwie ] jwie gRyh Awpn suqo qh hI phucXo Awie ]2043]
transliteration: Jaamvaan Badh Singh Ko Man(i) Lai Man Soukh(u) Paae|| Jaae|| Greh Aapan Souto Tah Hipahouchyo Aae||2043||
translation: Jamwant, the after killing the lion, returned to his home with a happy mind and went to sleep.2043.

gurmukhi: sqRwijq liK Byd nih sBnn khXo sunwie ] kiRSn mwir mih BRwq kau lInI min Cutkwih ]2044]
transliteration: Satraajit Likh(i) Bhed Nah(i) Sabhnan Kahyo Sounaae|| Krishan Daar(i) Muhe Bhraat Kau Leeniman(i) Chhoutkaahe||2044||
translation: On this side, Satrajit, thinking about the mystery, said within the hearing of everyone, “Krishna has snatched away the jewel after killing my brother.”2044.

gurmukhi: XoN suin kY crcw pRBjU Apny iFg jw iqh ko su bulwXo ] sqRwjIq khY muih BRwq hnXo hir jU min hyq sunwXo ]
transliteration: Yon Su(i) Kai Charchaa Prabhjoo Apne Dhig Jaa Tih Ko Su Bulaayo|| Satraajeet Kahai Muh(i) Bhraat Hanyo Har(i) Joo Man(i) Het Sounaayo||
translation: Hearing this discussion, the Lord called him; Satrajit said again, “Krishna has killed my brother for the sake of the jewel;”

gurmukhi: AYso kubol suny mnUAw hmro Aiq kRoDih sMig qwXo ] qw qy clo qumhUM iqh soD kau hau hU clo kih Kojn DwXo ]2045]
transliteration: Aiso Koubol Soune Manooaa Hamro At(i) Krodhah(i) Ke San(i) Taayo|| Taa Te Chalo Toumhoontih Sodh Kau Hau Hoo Chalo Kah(i) Khojan Dhaayo||2045||
translation: Hearing these words, the mind of Krishna was filled with rage; he said, “you should also accompany me for searching you brother.”2045.

gurmukhi: jwdv lY biRjnwQ jbY Apny sMg Kojn qwih isDwry ] AsÍpqI ibnu pRwn pry su qhI ey gey doaU jwie inhwry ]
transliteration: Jaadav Lai Brijnaath Jabai Apne San Khojan Taah(i) Sidhdare|| Asoupatibin(u) Praan Dare Su Tahie Gad Dooo Jaae Jjaae Nihdare||
translation: Krishna, taking the Yadavas with him, went in search of the brother of Satrajit and reached there where Ashvapati was lying dead;

gurmukhi: kyhir ko qh Koj ipKXo ieh vwhI hny Bt AYso pukwry ] Awgy jO jwih qO isMG ipKXo miRq cauk pry sB paurK vwry ]2046]
transliteration: Kehar(i) Ko Tah Khoj Pikhyo Eh Vaahihane Bhat Aiso Poukdare|| Ooge Jau Jaah(i) Singh Pikhyo Mrit Chaouk Dare Sabh Paurakh Vdare||2046||
translation: The people looked for the lion here and there and imagined that he had been killed by the lion; when they advanced further a little, they saw the dead lion; seeing him, all of them were wonder-struck and got agitated.2046.

gurmukhi: qh Bwlk ky Koj kau icqY rhY isr nwie ] jhw Koj iqh jwq pg qhw jwq Bt Dwie ]2047]
transliteration: Tah Dhaalak Ke Khoj Kau Chitai Rahai Sir Naae|| Jahaa Khoj Tih Jaat Pag Tahaa Jaat Bhat Dhaae||2047||
translation: All of them went with bowed heads in search of the bear and wherever they found the footprints of the bear, they continued to move in that direction.2047.

gurmukhi: jw pRB ky brdwn dey Asurwr ijqy sB dwnv Bwgy ] jw pRB SqRn nws kXo ss sUr Qpy iPr kwrj lwgy ]
transliteration: Jaa Prabh Ke Bardaan Dae Asuraar Jite Sabh Daanav Bhaage|| Jaa Prabh Shatran Naas Kayo Sas Soor Thape Phir Kaaraj Laage||
translation: The Lord, whose boon resulted in the victory over the demons, who had all run away; the Lord who destroyed the enemies and Surya and Chandra began to perform their duties;
